page.title: 10 CAMPEY'S HAULAGE
page.content: Campey's is situated in Station Road,Hambleton.In Hambleton they store goods,and at Thorpe Willoughby they have the transport depot.They store all kinds of animal foods,wood veneers used by saddle makers,spill dry,used by garages to clean oil from floors,sugar,cane and block,the sugar is ground in a nibbler,cocoa waste also tapioca flour used by Allied Mills.Tractor kits from Japan,beetroot for Hazelwoods in Selby and lawn mowers from New Zealand.They have 51-54 lorries at Thorpe Willoughby and employ 8 men at Hambleton.Before Campey's began there was a Jam Factory on the site but it was destroyed by a fire in 1962/63.The company operate all over the U.K and usually collect from ships at Immingham Docks.They have a private weighbridge which can weigh 50 tons and is 50 feet long.
